term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - inner filter effect
term.title: inner filter effect

item.text: In an emission experiment, an apparent decrease in emission quantum yield and/or distortion of bandshape as a result of reabsorption of emitted radiation.
During a light irradiation experiment, absorption of incident radiation by a species other than the intended primary absorber.

term.sources: 'Glossary of terms used in photochemistry (IUPAC Recommendations 1996)' Verhoeven, J.W.; Pure and Applied Chemistry 1996 68(12) 2223
